item.title: Achieving Remote Desktop Nirvana (Revised)
item.description:
Occasionally, I discover a tool or feature that makes me both impressed and surprised that I hadn’t known about it sooner. One such discovery is a tool within the Windows Server 2003 Administration Tools Pack. During a remote support session, I observed a client using an unfamiliar feature. It allowed him to effortlessly switch between multiple servers from a single window, much like a VNC or Citrix management console. To my surprise, he explained it was a standard part of the Server 2003 Admin Pack, specifically the “Remote Desktops” MMC snap-in...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/achieving-remote-desktop-nirvana-revised/
